sections.heading: 1. INTRODUCTION
sections.text: [COMPANY_NAME] is committed to protecting your personal data. This notice explains how we collect and use your personal data during and after your employment.

sections.heading: 2. WHO WE ARE
sections.text:
Data controller: [COMPANY_NAME]
Address: [ADDRESS]
Email: [DATA_PROTECTION_EMAIL]
ICO registration: [ICO_NUMBER]
Data Protection Officer: [DPO_NAME] (if applicable) - [DPO_EMAIL]

sections.heading: 3. WHAT DATA WE COLLECT
sections.text:
We collect and process the following categories:

**Personal details:** Name, date of birth, gender, contact details, emergency contacts, photo

**Recruitment:** Application form, CV, references, interview notes, qualifications, right to work documents

**Contract and pay:** Job title, start date, employment contract, salary, bank details, tax code, NI number, pension details, benefits

**Performance:** Appraisals, training records, performance reviews, objectives

**Absence:** Sickness records, fit notes, holiday records, other leave

**Conduct:** Disciplinary and grievance records, investigation notes

**Technical:** Email usage, internet usage, CCTV footage (if applicable), access logs, IT system data

**Equality monitoring:** [IF COLLECTED: Diversity data (ethnicity, disability, religion) - collected separately and anonymized]

**Special category data:**
- Health data (sickness, occupational health referrals, reasonable adjustments)
- [IF COLLECTED: Trade union membership, criminal convictions (DBS checks)]

sections.heading: 4. HOW WE COLLECT DATA
sections.text:
We collect data from:
- You (application forms, contracts, timesheets)
- Your manager (performance reviews, absence records)
- IT systems (email, internet, access logs)
- Third parties (references, DBS checks, occupational health)
- Publicly available sources (LinkedIn, Companies House)

sections.heading: 5. WHY WE USE YOUR DATA
sections.text:
| Purpose | Lawful Basis (Article 6) | Special Category Basis (Article 9) |
|---------|--------------------------|-------------------------------------|
| To perform the employment contract | Contract (6(1)(b)) | - |
| To pay you and administer benefits | Contract (6(1)(b)) | - |
| To comply with employment law | Legal obligation (6(1)(c)) | Legal claims (9(2)(f)), Employment law (9(2)(b)) |
| Tax and NI obligations | Legal obligation (6(1)(c)) | - |
| Recruitment and selection | Legitimate interests (6(1)(f)) | - |
| Performance management | Legitimate interests (6(1)(f)) | - |
| Disciplinary and grievance | Legitimate interests (6(1)(f)) | Legal claims (9(2)(f)) |
| Sickness absence management | Legitimate interests (6(1)(f)) | Health/social care (9(2)(h)), Legal claims (9(2)(f)) |
| Occupational health | Legitimate interests (6(1)(f)) | Health/social care (9(2)(h)), Explicit consent (9(2)(a)) |
| IT security and monitoring | Legitimate interests (6(1)(f)) | - |
| Equality monitoring | Legitimate interests (6(1)(f)) | Explicit consent (9(2)(a)) |
| Legal claims | Legitimate interests (6(1)(f)) | Legal claims (9(2)(f)) |

Legitimate interests: We have a legitimate business interest in managing employment effectively, ensuring workplace security, and protecting our business. We have balanced this against your rights.

sections.heading: 6. WHO WE SHARE DATA WITH
sections.text:
We share your personal data with:

**Internal:**
- HR department
- Your line manager and department
- IT department
- Payroll department

**External:**
- HMRC (tax and NI)
- Pension provider ([PROVIDER])
- Payroll provider ([PROVIDER])
- Occupational health provider
- Insurance companies (benefits)
- Legal and professional advisers
- Recruiters (references)
- Regulatory bodies (ICO, HSE, etc.)
- Law enforcement (if required)

We require all third parties to maintain confidentiality and comply with data protection law.

sections.heading: 7. INTERNATIONAL TRANSFERS
sections.text:
[IF NO TRANSFERS: We do not transfer your personal data outside the UK.]

[IF TRANSFERS: We transfer data to [COUNTRIES/SERVICES - e.g., cloud services in USA].
Safeguards: [Standard Contractual Clauses / UK adequacy decision / IDTA]
You can request a copy of the safeguards: [EMAIL]]

sections.heading: 8. HOW LONG WE KEEP DATA
sections.text:
We retain your data for:

- Recruitment records (unsuccessful): 6 months
- Personnel file: 6 years after employment ends
- Payroll/tax records: 6 years from tax year end
- Sickness records: 3 years after employment ends
- Disciplinary/grievance: 6 years after conclusion
- Pension records: Permanent (transferred to scheme)

See our Data Retention Policy for full details: [LINK]

sections.heading: 9. YOUR RIGHTS
sections.text:
You have the right to:

1. **Access:** Request a copy of your personal data (free)
2. **Rectification:** Correct inaccurate data
3. **Erasure:** Request deletion (in limited circumstances)
4. **Restriction:** Limit how we use your data
5. **Portability:** Receive your data in a structured format (where processing is automated and based on consent/contract)
6. **Object:** Object to processing based on legitimate interests (including profiling)
7. **Automated decisions:** Not be subject to solely automated decisions with significant effects (we do not currently use automated decision-making)

To exercise your rights, contact: [DATA_PROTECTION_EMAIL]

Response time: 1 month (extendable to 3 months if complex)

**Right to object to monitoring:**
You can object to monitoring of emails/internet. However, we may still monitor if necessary for security, legal compliance, or investigating misconduct.

**Limitations:**
Some rights do not apply in certain circumstances (e.g., we cannot delete data required for legal compliance or legal claims).

sections.heading: 10. MONITORING
sections.text:
We may monitor:
- Email and internet usage (to ensure security, prevent misuse, and comply with legal obligations)
- CCTV (for security - see separate CCTV notice)
- Access to buildings and systems (security)
- Phone calls (quality and training - with notification)

Monitoring is proportionate and complies with the Telecommunications (Lawful Business Practice) (Interception of Communications) Regulations 2000.

You should have no expectation of privacy for Company email/systems used for personal purposes.

sections.heading: 11. AUTOMATED DECISIONS
sections.text:
[IF NO ADM: We do not use automated decision-making or profiling.]

[IF ADM: We use automated decision-making for [PURPOSE - e.g., initial CV screening]. You have the right to request human review.]

sections.heading: 12. DATA SECURITY
sections.text:
We protect your data using:
- Encryption
- Access controls (role-based)
- Secure IT systems
- Staff training
- Confidentiality agreements
- Regular security audits

You must also protect data by:
- Using strong passwords
- Not sharing login credentials
- Reporting security incidents immediately

sections.heading: 13. CHANGES TO THIS NOTICE
sections.text:
We may update this notice. The current version is always available: [URL]

Last updated: [DATE]

sections.text:

2. Contact our DPO: [DPO_EMAIL]
3. Complain to the ICO:

   - Helpline: 0303 123 1113
